intro: Antidaphne hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduran antidaphne, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a distinctive yellowish-green color. Antidaphne hondurensis is known for containing cardiac glycosides, which can be toxic to humans and animals.
